text: Rzepka ()https://surnames.behindthename.com/name/rzepka/submitted is a Polish surname and given name. ==Meaning and origin== In Polish, the word means kneecap,https://en.wiktionary.org/wiki/rzepka but the name is actually derived from the diminutive of rzepa (meaning turnip).https://www.ancestry.co.uk/name- origin?surname=rzepkahttps://surnames.behindthename.com/name/rzepka/submitted ==Prevalence== Outside of Poland, the name is also prevalent as a surname in Germany and the United States.http://forebears.io/surnames/rzepka ==Notable people== Notable people with this name include: * Józef Rzepka (1913-1951), Polish soldier * Michelle Rzepka (born 1983), American bobsledder * Rzepicha (also known as Rzepka), 9th century Polish ruler ==See also== * Rzepa ==References==
title: Rzepka
